messages.content: Write a SQL query to list all students enrolled in the course 'Database Systems'.
SELECT S.FIRSTNAME, S.LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID JOIN A_COURSES C ON E.COURSEID = C.COURSEID WHERE C.COURSENAME = 'Database Systems';
Write a PL/SQL block to update the birthdate of a student with STUDENTID = 101.
Create a SQL query to list all professors and their respective departments.
SELECT P.PROFNAME, D.DEPTNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID;
Write a SQL query to count the number of courses in each department.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME, COUNT(C.COURSEID) AS COURSE_COUNT FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D JOIN A_COURSES C ON D.DEPTID = C.DEPTID GROUP BY D.DEPTNAME;
Write a PL/SQL procedure to enroll a student into a course given student ID and course ID.

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE enroll_student(p_studentid IN NUMBER, p_courseid IN NUMBER) IS BEGIN INSERT INTO A_ENROLLMENTS(STUDENTID, COURSEID, ENROLLDATE) VALUES (p_studentid, p_courseid, SYSDATE); COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to find students who enrolled after January 1, 2023.
SELECT S.FIRSTNAME, S.LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID WHERE E.ENROLLDATE > TO_DATE('2023-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Generate a script to create an index on DEPTID in the A_PROFESSORS table.
CREATE INDEX idx_deptid ON A_PROFESSORS(DEPTID);
Create a DBMS_SCHEDULER job to run a student report every Friday at 6 PM.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'student_report_job', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN -- your logic here END;', start_date => SYSTIMESTAMP, repeat_interval => 'FREQ=WEEKLY; BYDAY=FRI; BYHOUR=18; BYMINUTE=0; BYSECOND=0;', enabled => TRUE); END;
Write an ALTER TABLE statement to modify the length of LASTNAME in A_STUDENTS to 100.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS MODIFY LASTNAME VARCHAR2(100);
Fix this SQL query: SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSE = 'Math';
SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSENAME = 'Math';
Write a SQL query to get the full names of all students.
SELECT FIRSTNAME || ' ' || LASTNAME AS FULLNAME FROM A_STUDENTS;
Create a SQL query to find professors who do not teach any course.
SELECT P.PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS P WHERE P.PROFID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT PROFID FROM A_COURSES);
Write a PL/SQL trigger to log enrollment inserts into a custom log table.

CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_log_enrollment AFTER INSERT ON A_ENROLLMENTS FOR EACH ROW BEGIN INSERT INTO ENROLLMENT_LOG(STUDENTID, COURSEID, ENROLLDATE) VALUES (:NEW.STUDENTID, :NEW.COURSEID, :NEW.ENROLLDATE); END;
Write a SQL script to export the A_STUDENTS table to a dump file.
expdp username/password tables=A_STUDENTS directory=DATA_PUMP_DIR dumpfile=students.dmp logfile=students.log
Fix this SQL query: SELECT PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS ON DEPTID;
SELECT PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID;
Write a SQL query to list courses along with the number of enrolled students.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS ENROLL_COUNT FROM A_COURSES C LEFT JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME;
Write a PL/SQL block to delete a course by COURSEID if no student is enrolled in it.
DECLARE v_count NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_count FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE COURSEID = 101; IF v_count = 0 THEN DELETE FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSEID = 101; COMMIT; END IF; END;
Create a SQL query to find the department name of each student.
SELECT S.FIRSTNAME, S.LASTNAME, D.DEPTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID JOIN A_COURSES C ON E.COURSEID = C.COURSEID JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON C.DEPTID = D.DEPTID;
Write a SQL query to list courses taught by professors in the 'Computer Science' department.
SELECT C.COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES C JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON C.PROFID = P.PROFID JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID WHERE D.DEPTNAME = 'Computer Science';
Fix the SQL query: SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE > 2022-01-01;
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE > TO_DATE('2022-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Write a SQL query to list all students enrolled in more than one course.
SELECT S.FIRSTNAME, S.LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID GROUP BY S.FIRSTNAME, S.LASTNAME HAVING COUNT(E.COURSEID) > 1;
Write a PL/SQL function to return the number of students enrolled in a given course ID.

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_enrollment_count(p_courseid NUMBER) RETURN NUMBER IS v_count NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_count FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE COURSEID = p_courseid; RETURN v_count; END;
Write a SQL query to find courses not taken by any student.
SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSEID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT COURSEID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS);
Generate a command to drop the index named idx_courseid on A_COURSES.
DROP INDEX idx_courseid;
Write a DBMS_SCHEDULER job to update a report table every 12 hours.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'report_update_job', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN -- report logic here END;', start_date => SYSTIMESTAMP, repeat_interval => 'FREQ=HOURLY; INTERVAL=12;', enabled => TRUE); END;
Create an ALTER TABLE script to drop the PROFID column from A_COURSES.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES DROP COLUMN PROFID;
Fix the SQL error in: SELECT * A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTID = 10;
SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTID = 10;
Write a SQL query to find the oldest student.
SELECT FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME, BIRTHDATE FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE = (SELECT MIN(BIRTHDATE) FROM A_STUDENTS);
Write a PL/SQL block that logs deleted course names into a backup table before deletion.

DECLARE v_name VARCHAR2(100); BEGIN SELECT COURSENAME INTO v_name FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSEID = 201; INSERT INTO COURSE_BACKUP(COURSENAME, DELETED_AT) VALUES(v_name, SYSDATE); DELETE FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSEID = 201; COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to list each department and the number of professors in it.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME, COUNT(P.PROFID) AS PROFESSOR_COUNT FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D LEFT JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON D.DEPTID = P.DEPTID GROUP BY D.DEPTNAME;
Write a SQL query to get professor names who teach more than 2 courses.
SELECT P.PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_COURSES C ON P.PROFID = C.PROFID GROUP BY P.PROFNAME HAVING COUNT(C.COURSEID) > 2;
Create a PL/SQL procedure to update a student's last name given student ID.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE update_lastname(p_id IN NUMBER, p_lastname IN VARCHAR2) IS BEGIN UPDATE A_STUDENTS SET LASTNAME = p_lastname WHERE STUDENTID = p_id; COMMIT; END;
Fix the error: SELECT COUNT FROM A_COURSES;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM A_COURSES;
Write a SQL query to list all departments that have at least one course assigned.
SELECT DISTINCT D.DEPTNAME FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D JOIN A_COURSES C ON D.DEPTID = C.DEPTID;
Generate an export command for all tables in the schema.
expdp username/password schemas=your_schema_name directory=DATA_PUMP_DIR dumpfile=full_export.dmp logfile=full_export.log
Write a SQL query to list courses along with their professor's name.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, P.PROFNAME FROM A_COURSES C JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON C.PROFID = P.PROFID;
Write a SQL query to show students and their age.
SELECT FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME, FLOOR(MONTHS_BETWEEN(SYSDATE, BIRTHDATE)/12) AS AGE FROM A_STUDENTS;
Write a SQL query to list all professors without departments assigned.
SELECT PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTID IS NULL;
Fix: SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE = '2022-10-01';
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE = TO_DATE('2022-10-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Write a PL/SQL procedure to transfer a student from one course to another.

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE transfer_student(p_studentid NUMBER, p_old_course NUMBER, p_new_course NUMBER) IS BEGIN DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE STUDENTID = p_studentid AND COURSEID = p_old_course; INSERT INTO A_ENROLLMENTS(STUDENTID, COURSEID, ENROLLDATE) VALUES (p_studentid, p_new_course, SYSDATE); COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to get all courses along with the number of students enrolled in each.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS STUDENT_COUNT FROM A_COURSES C LEFT JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME;
Write a PL/SQL block to increase all student IDs by 1000.
BEGIN UPDATE A_STUDENTS SET STUDENTID = STUDENTID + 1000; COMMIT; END;
Create an index on the ENROLLDATE column of A_ENROLLMENTS.
CREATE INDEX idx_enrolldate ON A_ENROLLMENTS(ENROLLDATE);
Write a SQL query to get the full name and age of all students born after 2000.
SELECT FIRSTNAME || ' ' || LASTNAME AS FULLNAME, FLOOR(MONTHS_BETWEEN(SYSDATE, BIRTHDATE)/12) AS AGE FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE > TO_DATE('2000-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Fix the SQL query: SELECT FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE FIRSTNAME = 'John';
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE FIRSTNAME = 'John';
Write a PL/SQL block to insert a new professor with ID 301 and name 'Dr. Stone' into department 10.
BEGIN INSERT INTO A_PROFESSORS(PROFID, PROFNAME, DEPTID) VALUES (301, 'Dr. Stone', 10); COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to retrieve the top 5 most recent enrollments.
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS ORDER BY ENROLLDATE DESC FETCH FIRST 5 ROWS ONLY;
Generate a CRON expression to run a script every day at 1 AM.
Create an ALTER TABLE command to rename the column COURSENAME to TITLE in A_COURSES.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES RENAME COLUMN COURSENAME TO TITLE;
Fix the error in: SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSEID = 'CS101';
SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSEID = 101; -- assuming COURSEID is numeric
Write a SQL query to list the departments that have no professors.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D LEFT JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON D.DEPTID = P.DEPTID WHERE P.PROFID IS NULL;
Write a PL/SQL trigger to prevent deletion of any student enrolled in a course.

CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER prevent_student_delete BEFORE DELETE ON A_STUDENTS FOR EACH ROW BEGIN IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE STUDENTID = :OLD.STUDENTID) THEN RAISE_APPLICATION_ERROR(-20001, 'Cannot delete student who is enrolled in a course.'); END IF; END;
Generate a data pump import command for A_PROFESSORS.
impdp username/password tables=A_PROFESSORS directory=DATA_PUMP_DIR dumpfile=professors.dmp logfile=professors_import.log
Write a SQL query to get the number of students per course, showing courses with zero students too.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS STUDENT_COUNT FROM A_COURSES C LEFT JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME;
Write a SQL query to list students whose last names start with 'S'.
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE LASTNAME LIKE 'S%';
Fix this SQL: SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTNAME = 'Engineering';
SELECT P.* FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID WHERE D.DEPTNAME = 'Engineering';
Write a SQL query to find professors who share the same department.

SELECT P1.PROFNAME AS PROF1, P2.PROFNAME AS PROF2, D.DEPTNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS P1 JOIN A_PROFESSORS P2 ON P1.DEPTID = P2.DEPTID AND P1.PROFID < P2.PROFID JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P1.DEPTID = D.DEPTID;
Write a PL/SQL procedure to remove all students who are not enrolled in any course.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE remove_unenrolled_students IS BEGIN DELETE FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT STUDENTID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS); COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to calculate the average age of students.
SELECT AVG(FLOOR(MONTHS_BETWEEN(SYSDATE, BIRTHDATE)/12)) AS AVG_AGE FROM A_STUDENTS;
Write an ALTER TABLE command to add a column EMAIL to A_STUDENTS.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS ADD (EMAIL VARCHAR2(100));
Write a SQL query to list students along with the courses they are enrolled in.
SELECT S.FIRSTNAME, S.LASTNAME, C.COURSENAME FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID JOIN A_COURSES C ON E.COURSEID = C.COURSEID;
Write a PL/SQL block to assign all students to a default course with ID 100.
BEGIN FOR r IN (SELECT STUDENTID FROM A_STUDENTS) LOOP INSERT INTO A_ENROLLMENTS(STUDENTID, COURSEID, ENROLLDATE) VALUES (r.STUDENTID, 100, SYSDATE); END LOOP; COMMIT; END;
Write an ALTER TABLE statement to change the length of FIRSTNAME in A_STUDENTS to 100.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS MODIFY (FIRSTNAME VARCHAR2(100));
Fix the SQL: SELECT PROFID, COUNT(*) FROM A_COURSES;
SELECT PROFID, COUNT(*) FROM A_COURSES GROUP BY PROFID;
Write a SQL query to find students who enrolled in 2023.
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM ENROLLDATE) = 2023;
Write a PL/SQL trigger to automatically set ENROLLDATE to current date if NULL during insert.
CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER set_enroll_date BEFORE INSERT ON A_ENROLLMENTS FOR EACH ROW BEGIN IF :NEW.ENROLLDATE IS NULL THEN :NEW.ENROLLDATE := SYSDATE; END IF; END;
Write a SQL query to find courses that have no assigned professor.
SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE PROFID IS NULL;
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS ORDER BY AGE DESC;
SELECT *, FLOOR(MONTHS_BETWEEN(SYSDATE, BIRTHDATE)/12) AS AGE FROM A_STUDENTS ORDER BY AGE DESC;
Write a PL/SQL block to update department name from 'Science' to 'Natural Sciences'.
BEGIN UPDATE A_DEPARTMENTS SET DEPTNAME = 'Natural Sciences' WHERE DEPTNAME = 'Science'; COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to get all enrollments that happened in the last 7 days.
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE >= SYSDATE - 7;
Create an index on the DEPTNAME column of A_DEPARTMENTS.
CREATE INDEX idx_deptname ON A_DEPARTMENTS(DEPTNAME);
Write a PL/SQL function that returns the department name of a professor by PROFID.

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_prof_dept(p_profid NUMBER) RETURN VARCHAR2 IS v_name VARCHAR2(100); BEGIN SELECT D.DEPTNAME INTO v_name FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID WHERE P.PROFID = p_profid; RETURN v_name; END;
Write a SQL query to get students born before 1990.
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE < TO_DATE('1990-01-01','YYYY-MM-DD');
Fix the SQL: DELETE A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE COURSEID = 50;
DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE COURSEID = 50;
Write a SQL query to count the number of departments with more than 3 professors.
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT DEPTID FROM A_PROFESSORS GROUP BY DEPTID HAVING COUNT(*) > 3);
Write a PL/SQL block to backup A_PROFESSORS into a table A_PROFESSORS_BAK.
BEGIN INSERT INTO A_PROFESSORS_BAK SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS; COMMIT; END;
Write an ALTER TABLE command to drop the EMAIL column from A_STUDENTS.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS DROP COLUMN EMAIL;
Write a SQL query to list the first and last names of students enrolled in course ID 200.
SELECT S.FIRSTNAME, S.LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID WHERE E.COURSEID = 200;
Write a SQL query to list professors and the number of courses they teach.
SELECT P.PROFNAME, COUNT(C.COURSEID) AS COURSE_COUNT FROM A_PROFESSORS P LEFT JOIN A_COURSES C ON P.PROFID = C.PROFID GROUP BY P.PROFNAME;
Write a PL/SQL procedure to delete a professor by ID if not teaching any course.

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE delete_free_professor(p_profid NUMBER) IS v_count NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_count FROM A_COURSES WHERE PROFID = p_profid; IF v_count = 0 THEN DELETE FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE PROFID = p_profid; COMMIT; END IF; END;
Write a SQL query to get the number of students enrolled in each department.

SELECT D.DEPTNAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS STUDENT_COUNT FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON D.DEPTID = P.DEPTID JOIN A_COURSES C ON P.PROFID = C.PROFID JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY D.DEPTNAME;
Create a PL/SQL block to insert a student if they do not already exist.

DECLARE v_count NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_count FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID = 123; IF v_count = 0 THEN INSERT INTO A_STUDENTS(STUDENTID, FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME, BIRTHDATE) VALUES (123, 'Alice', 'Walker', TO_DATE('2002-03-15','YYYY-MM-DD')); END IF; COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to list all courses and their department names.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, D.DEPTNAME FROM A_COURSES C JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON C.DEPTID = D.DEPTID;
Fix the SQL: INSERT INTO A_ENROLLMENTS VALUES (1001, NULL, SYSDATE);
INSERT INTO A_ENROLLMENTS(STUDENTID, COURSEID, ENROLLDATE) VALUES (1001, <course_id>, SYSDATE); -- Replace <course_id> with a valid value
Write a SQL query to get all students who are not enrolled in any course.
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT STUDENTID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS);
Create a PL/SQL trigger to log inserts into A_COURSES into a log table.
CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_log_course_insert AFTER INSERT ON A_COURSES FOR EACH ROW BEGIN INSERT INTO A_COURSES_LOG(COURSEID, LOG_DATE) VALUES (:NEW.COURSEID, SYSDATE); END;
Write a SQL query to get course names and number of students per course, sorted descending.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS STUDENT_COUNT FROM A_COURSES C LEFT JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME ORDER BY STUDENT_COUNT DESC;
Write an ALTER TABLE command to add a CHECK constraint on BIRTHDATE to ensure it's before today.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS ADD CONSTRAINT chk_birthdate CHECK (BIRTHDATE < SYSDATE);
Fix the SQL: UPDATE A_DEPARTMENTS SET DEPTNAME = Engineering WHERE DEPTID = 5;
UPDATE A_DEPARTMENTS SET DEPTNAME = 'Engineering' WHERE DEPTID = 5;
Write a SQL query to count enrollments per month in 2024.

SELECT TO_CHAR(ENROLLDATE, 'YYYY-MM') AS MONTH, COUNT(*) AS ENROLL_COUNT FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE BETWEEN TO_DATE('2024-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD') AND TO_DATE('2024-12-31', 'YYYY-MM-DD') GROUP BY TO_CHAR(ENROLLDATE, 'YYYY-MM') ORDER BY MONTH;
Write a PL/SQL function to return student full name by ID.

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_student_name(p_id NUMBER) RETURN VARCHAR2 IS v_name VARCHAR2(100); BEGIN SELECT FIRSTNAME || ' ' || LASTNAME INTO v_name FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID = p_id; RETURN v_name; END;
Write a SQL query to get professors who are not assigned to any course.
SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE PROFID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT PROFID FROM A_COURSES);
Create an index on the COURSEID column of A_ENROLLMENTS.
CREATE INDEX idx_courseid_enroll ON A_ENROLLMENTS(COURSEID);
Write a SQL query to get the number of courses per department.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME, COUNT(C.COURSEID) AS COURSE_COUNT FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D LEFT JOIN A_COURSES C ON D.DEPTID = C.DEPTID GROUP BY D.DEPTNAME;
Fix the SQL: SELECT ENROLLDATE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE = '2024-01-15';
SELECT ENROLLDATE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE = TO_DATE('2024-01-15', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Write a PL/SQL block to delete enrollments older than 5 years.
BEGIN DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE < ADD_MONTHS(SYSDATE, -60); COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to list students and their birth years.
SELECT FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME, EXTRACT(YEAR FROM BIRTHDATE) AS BIRTH_YEAR FROM A_STUDENTS;
Write a PL/SQL block to update professor names to uppercase.
BEGIN UPDATE A_PROFESSORS SET PROFNAME = UPPER(PROFNAME); COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to get the total number of students.
SELECT COUNT(*) AS TOTAL_STUDENTS FROM A_STUDENTS;
Fix the SQL: SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE DEPTID IN '10,20';
SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE DEPTID IN (10, 20);
Write a SQL query to list all professors with their department names.
SELECT P.PROFNAME, D.DEPTNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID;
Create a PL/SQL procedure to enroll a student into a course given student ID and course ID.

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE enroll_student(p_studentid NUMBER, p_courseid NUMBER) IS BEGIN INSERT INTO A_ENROLLMENTS (STUDENTID, COURSEID, ENROLLDATE) VALUES (p_studentid, p_courseid, SYSDATE); COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to find all students who have never enrolled in any course.
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID NOT IN (SELECT STUDENTID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS);
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSENAME = "Mathematics";
SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSENAME = 'Mathematics';
Write a SQL query to count how many students enrolled in each course.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS ENROLL_COUNT FROM A_COURSES C LEFT JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME;
Write a PL/SQL trigger to prevent inserting a course with an empty COURSENAME.

CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_check_course_name BEFORE INSERT ON A_COURSES FOR EACH ROW BEGIN IF :NEW.COURSENAME IS NULL OR TRIM(:NEW.COURSENAME) = '' THEN RAISE_APPLICATION_ERROR(-20001, 'Course name cannot be empty'); END IF; END;
Write an ALTER TABLE statement to add a new column COURSE_DESCRIPTION to A_COURSES.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES ADD COURSE_DESCRIPTION VARCHAR2(255);
Write a SQL query to get the last names of students born after 2000.
SELECT LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE > TO_DATE('2000-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Fix the SQL: SELECT PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTID = '5';
SELECT PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTID = 5;
Write a SQL query to get all courses taught by professor 'John Smith'.
SELECT C.COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES C JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON C.PROFID = P.PROFID WHERE P.PROFNAME = 'John Smith';
Write a PL/SQL block to update all student last names to 'Doe' where last name is NULL.
BEGIN UPDATE A_STUDENTS SET LASTNAME = 'Doe' WHERE LASTNAME IS NULL; COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to find departments with no professors assigned.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D WHERE D.DEPTID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT DEPTID FROM A_PROFESSORS);
Create an index on STUDENTID in A_ENROLLMENTS for faster searches.
CREATE INDEX idx_studentid_enroll ON A_ENROLLMENTS(STUDENTID);
Write a SQL query to count the number of professors per department.
SELECT DEPTID, COUNT(*) AS PROF_COUNT FROM A_PROFESSORS GROUP BY DEPTID;
Fix the SQL: DELETE A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE STUDENTID = 123;
DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE STUDENTID = 123;
Write a SQL query to list all courses whose names start with 'Intro'.
SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSENAME LIKE 'Intro%';
Write a PL/SQL procedure to change a professor's department given PROFID and new DEPTID.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE update_prof_dept(p_profid NUMBER, p_deptid NUMBER) IS BEGIN UPDATE A_PROFESSORS SET DEPTID = p_deptid WHERE PROFID = p_profid; COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to find courses with more than 10 students enrolled.
SELECT C.COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES C JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME HAVING COUNT(E.STUDENTID) > 10;
Write an ALTER TABLE command to rename column COURSENAME to COURSE_TITLE in A_COURSES.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES RENAME COLUMN COURSENAME TO COURSE_TITLE;
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE FIRSTNAME = John;
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE FIRSTNAME = 'John';
Write a SQL query to get all students enrolled in the 'Computer Science' department.

SELECT S.* FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID JOIN A_COURSES C ON E.COURSEID = C.COURSEID JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON C.DEPTID = D.DEPTID WHERE D.DEPTNAME = 'Computer Science';
Create a PL/SQL procedure to update a course name given COURSEID and new name.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE update_course_name(p_courseid NUMBER, p_newname VARCHAR2) IS BEGIN UPDATE A_COURSES SET COURSENAME = p_newname WHERE COURSEID = p_courseid; COMMIT; END;
Write a SQL query to list all departments with the number of courses offered.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME, COUNT(C.COURSEID) AS NUM_COURSES FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D LEFT JOIN A_COURSES C ON D.DEPTID = C.DEPTID GROUP BY D.DEPTNAME;
Fix the SQL: INSERT INTO A_PROFESSORS(PROFID, PROFNAME, DEPTID) VALUES (101, 'Dr. Smith', '10');

Create a tablespace named 'STUDENT_DATA' with 100MB size.
CREATE TABLESPACE STUDENT_DATA DATAFILE 'student_data.dbf' SIZE 100M AUTOEXTEND ON NEXT 10M MAXSIZE UNLIMITED;
Create a DBMS_SCHEDULER job to rebuild indexes every Sunday at 2 AM.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'weekly_index_rebuild', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN EXECUTE IMMEDIATE ''ALTER INDEX ALL REBUILD''; END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=SUN;BYHOUR=2;', enabled => TRUE); END;
Use ALTER TABLE to rename the column COURSENAME in A_COURSES to TITLE.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES RENAME COLUMN COURSENAME TO TITLE;
Fix the SQL: SELECT * A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE > SYSDATE - 30;
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE > SYSDATE - 30;
Write a SQL query to find students born after the year 2000.
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE > TO_DATE('2000-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Create a PL/SQL trigger to automatically assign a default DEPTID when a new professor is inserted.
CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER assign_default_dept BEFORE INSERT ON A_PROFESSORS FOR EACH ROW BEGIN IF :NEW.DEPTID IS NULL THEN :NEW.DEPTID := 1; END IF; END;
Rebuild the index on A_ENROLLMENTS for performance optimization.
ALTER INDEX A_ENROLLMENTS_PK REBUILD;
Schedule a CRON job to back up the A_COURSES table daily at midnight.
0 0 * * * exp user/password TABLES=A_COURSES FILE=a_courses_backup.dmp LOG=a_courses_backup.log
Generate a script to export all tables in the schema 'A_' to a single dump file.
expdp user/password DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR DUMPFILE=a_schema_full.dmp LOGFILE=a_schema_full.log SCHEMAS=A
Fix the SQL: SELECT PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS USING PROFID;
SELECT P.PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID;
Write a SQL query to display the number of students per course.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS STUDENT_COUNT FROM A_COURSES C LEFT JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME;
Create a PL/SQL package for student utilities (add_student, get_student_by_id).
Add a new partition to A_COURSES_PART for DEPTID = 4.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES_PART ADD PARTITION dept_4 VALUES (4);
Fix the SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM A_STUDENTS GROUP BY FIRSTNAME,;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM A_STUDENTS GROUP BY FIRSTNAME;
Write a SQL query to fetch professors teaching in more than one department.
SELECT PROFID FROM A_PROFESSORS GROUP BY PROFID HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT DEPTID) > 1;
Create a PL/SQL block to print total number of enrollments.
DECLARE v_total NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_total FROM A_ENROLLMENTS; DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Total Enrollments: ' || v_total); END;
Schedule a DBMS_SCHEDULER job to purge empty student records every month.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'purge_empty_students', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN DELETE FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE FIRSTNAME IS NULL AND LASTNAME IS NULL; END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=MONTHLY;BYMONTHDAY=1;BYHOUR=0;', enabled => TRUE); END;
Drop the foreign key constraint between A_ENROLLMENTS and A_COURSES.
ALTER TABLE A_ENROLLMENTS DROP CONSTRAINT fk_enroll_course;
Write a SQL query to get a list of courses along with the number of students enrolled in each.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS ENROLLMENT_COUNT FROM A_COURSES C LEFT JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME;
Create a PL/SQL procedure to update student last name given STUDENTID.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE update_last_name(p_studentid NUMBER, p_lastname VARCHAR2) IS BEGIN UPDATE A_STUDENTS SET LASTNAME = p_lastname WHERE STUDENTID = p_studentid; COMMIT; END;
Resize the tablespace 'STUDENT_DATA' to 500MB.
ALTER DATABASE DATAFILE 'student_data.dbf' RESIZE 500M;
Schedule a job using DBMS_SCHEDULER to generate a course report every Friday at 4 PM.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'weekly_course_report', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN NULL; END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=FRI;BYHOUR=16;', enabled => TRUE); END;
Write an ALTER TABLE script to change the length of LASTNAME column to 100 in A_STUDENTS.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS MODIFY (LASTNAME VARCHAR2(100));
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTID == 2;
SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTID = 2;
Write a SQL query to list all students with their age.
SELECT STUDENTID, FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME, TRUNC(MONTHS_BETWEEN(SYSDATE, BIRTHDATE)/12) AS AGE FROM A_STUDENTS;
Create a trigger to prevent deletion from A_COURSES if enrollments exist.

CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_prevent_course_delete BEFORE DELETE ON A_COURSES FOR EACH ROW BEGIN IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE COURSEID = :OLD.COURSEID) THEN RAISE_APPLICATION_ERROR(-20001, 'Cannot delete course with enrollments'); END IF; END;
Create a partitioned table from A_STUDENTS by year of birth.

CREATE TABLE A_STUDENTS_PART (STUDENTID NUMBER, FIRSTNAME VARCHAR2(50), LASTNAME VARCHAR2(50), BIRTHDATE DATE) PARTITION BY RANGE (BIRTHDATE) (PARTITION p_1990s VALUES LESS THAN (TO_DATE('2000-01-01','YYYY-MM-DD')), PARTITION p_2000s VALUES LESS THAN (TO_DATE('2010-01-01','YYYY-MM-DD')));
Use CRON to delete backups older than 30 days from backup folder.
0 3 * * * find /home/oracle/backups -name '*.dmp' -type f -mtime +30 -exec rm {} \;
Export only A_PROFESSORS table using Data Pump.
expdp user/password DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR DUMPFILE=professors.dmp LOGFILE=professors.log TABLES=A_PROFESSORS
Fix the SQL: SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE DEPTID IN '2', '3';
SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE DEPTID IN (2, 3);
Write a SQL query to list all departments along with the number of professors in each.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME, COUNT(P.PROFID) AS PROFESSOR_COUNT FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D LEFT JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON D.DEPTID = P.DEPTID GROUP BY D.DEPTNAME;
Create a PL/SQL function to return full student name given STUDENTID.

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_full_name(p_studentid NUMBER) RETURN VARCHAR2 IS v_name VARCHAR2(100); BEGIN SELECT FIRSTNAME || ' ' || LASTNAME INTO v_name FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID = p_studentid; RETURN v_name; END;
Add a constraint to ensure PROFNAME is not null in A_PROFESSORS.
ALTER TABLE A_PROFESSORS MODIFY (PROFNAME CONSTRAINT profname_not_null NOT NULL);
Schedule a DBMS_SCHEDULER job to archive enrollments quarterly.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'archive_enrollments_job', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN INSERT INTO ENROLLMENTS_ARCHIVE SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE < ADD_MONTHS(SYSDATE, -3); DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE < ADD_MONTHS(SYSDATE, -3); END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=MONTHLY;BYMONTHDAY=1;BYHOUR=2;BYMINUTE=0', enabled => TRUE); END;
Fix the SQL: INSERT INTO A_STUDENTS VALUES 100, 'John', 'Doe';
INSERT INTO A_STUDENTS (STUDENTID, FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME) VALUES (100, 'John', 'Doe');
Create a SQL query to fetch professors who teach more than 3 courses.
SELECT P.PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_COURSES C ON P.PROFID = C.PROFID GROUP BY P.PROFNAME HAVING COUNT(C.COURSEID) > 3;
Write a PL/SQL block that prints the number of students not enrolled in any course.
DECLARE v_count NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_count FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID NOT IN (SELECT STUDENTID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS); DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Unenrolled students: ' || v_count); END;
Drop a column named TEMP_COL from A_COURSES.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES DROP COLUMN TEMP_COL;
Write a SQL query to list students who enrolled in any course after January 1, 2023.
SELECT S.STUDENTID, S.FIRSTNAME, S.LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID WHERE E.ENROLLDATE > TO_DATE('2023-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Create a PL/SQL block to assign a professor to a course.
BEGIN UPDATE A_COURSES SET PROFID = 105 WHERE COURSEID = 203; COMMIT; END;
Create an index on DEPTID in A_COURSES to improve join performance.
CREATE INDEX idx_deptid_courses ON A_COURSES (DEPTID);
Schedule a daily job using DBMS_SCHEDULER to purge audit logs older than 7 days.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'purge_audit_logs', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN DELETE FROM AUDIT_LOG WHERE LOG_DATE < SYSDATE - 7; COMMIT; END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=DAILY;BYHOUR=2;BYMINUTE=0', enabled => TRUE); END;
Write an ALTER TABLE script to add EMAIL column to A_STUDENTS.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS ADD (EMAIL VARCHAR2(100));
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE = '2023-04-01';
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE = TO_DATE('2023-04-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Write a SQL query to list courses taught by professors from the 'Computer Science' department.
SELECT C.COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES C JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON C.PROFID = P.PROFID JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID WHERE D.DEPTNAME = 'Computer Science';
Create a PL/SQL trigger that logs deleted students into a backup table.

CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_log_student_delete BEFORE DELETE ON A_STUDENTS FOR EACH ROW BEGIN INSERT INTO A_STUDENTS_ARCHIVE VALUES (:OLD.STUDENTID, :OLD.FIRSTNAME, :OLD.LASTNAME, :OLD.BIRTHDATE); END;
Resize the datafile of USERS tablespace to 2GB.
ALTER DATABASE DATAFILE '/u01/app/oracle/oradata/ORCL/users01.dbf' RESIZE 2G;
Create a CRON job to export A_COURSES table weekly.
0 3 * * 0 expdp user/password tables=A_COURSES directory=DATA_PUMP_DIR dumpfile=courses.dmp logfile=courses.log
Fix the SQL: SELECT STUDENTID, FIRSTNAME + LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS;
SELECT STUDENTID, FIRSTNAME || ' ' || LASTNAME AS FULLNAME FROM A_STUDENTS;
Write a query to find the course with the highest number of enrollments.
SELECT C.COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES C JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME ORDER BY COUNT(E.STUDENTID) DESC FETCH FIRST 1 ROWS ONLY;
Create a PL/SQL procedure to insert a new student.

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE insert_student(p_id NUMBER, p_first VARCHAR2, p_last VARCHAR2, p_birth DATE) IS BEGIN INSERT INTO A_STUDENTS(STUDENTID, FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME, BIRTHDATE) VALUES (p_id, p_first, p_last, p_birth); COMMIT; END;
Enable auto-extend on the tablespace datafile.
ALTER DATABASE DATAFILE '/u01/app/oracle/oradata/ORCL/users01.dbf' AUTOEXTEND ON NEXT 100M MAXSIZE UNLIMITED;
Create a DBMS_SCHEDULER job to refresh a materialized view every hour.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'refresh_mv_hourly', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN DBMS_MVIEW.REFRESH(''MV_ENROLLMENTS''); END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=HOURLY', enabled => TRUE); END;
Generate a script to rename column FIRSTNAME to GIVEN_NAME in A_STUDENTS.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS RENAME COLUMN FIRSTNAME TO GIVEN_NAME;
Fix the SQL: DELETE FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE PROFID = 'abc';
Write a SQL query to get total number of courses per department.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME, COUNT(C.COURSEID) AS COURSE_COUNT FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D LEFT JOIN A_COURSES C ON D.DEPTID = C.DEPTID GROUP BY D.DEPTNAME;
Create a PL/SQL block to delete students born before 1990.
BEGIN DELETE FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE < TO_DATE('1990-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD'); COMMIT; END;
Drop the index on A_COURSES.DEPTID if exists.
DROP INDEX idx_deptid_courses;
Write a SQL query to list the full names of students enrolled in course ID 105.
SELECT S.FIRSTNAME || ' ' || S.LASTNAME AS FULL_NAME FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID WHERE E.COURSEID = 105;
Create a PL/SQL procedure to enroll a student into a course.

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE enroll_student(p_studentid NUMBER, p_courseid NUMBER) IS BEGIN INSERT INTO A_ENROLLMENTS (STUDENTID, COURSEID, ENROLLDATE) VALUES (p_studentid, p_courseid, SYSDATE); COMMIT; END;
Create a tablespace named COURSE_DATA with initial size 100MB.
CREATE TABLESPACE COURSE_DATA DATAFILE 'course_data01.dbf' SIZE 100M AUTOEXTEND ON NEXT 10M MAXSIZE UNLIMITED;
Schedule a weekly job using DBMS_SCHEDULER to recalculate enrollment stats every Sunday at midnight.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'weekly_enrollment_stats', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN recalculate_enrollment_stats(); END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=SUN;BYHOUR=0;BYMINUTE=0', enabled => TRUE); END;
Alter A_STUDENTS table to drop the BIRTHDATE column.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS DROP COLUMN BIRTHDATE;
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE > 01-01-2000;
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE > TO_DATE('2000-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Write a SQL query to count how many students each professor teaches.
SELECT P.PROFNAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS STUDENT_COUNT FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_COURSES C ON P.PROFID = C.PROFID JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY P.PROFNAME;
Create a PL/SQL function that returns the department name for a given course ID.

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_dept_name(p_courseid NUMBER) RETURN VARCHAR2 IS v_deptname VARCHAR2(100); BEGIN SELECT D.DEPTNAME INTO v_deptname FROM A_COURSES C JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON C.DEPTID = D.DEPTID WHERE C.COURSEID = p_courseid; RETURN v_deptname; END;
Create a backup of the A_ENROLLMENTS table using Data Pump export.
expdp user/password DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR DUMPFILE=enrollments_backup.dmp LOGFILE=enrollments_backup.log TABLES=A_ENROLLMENTS
Schedule a CRON job to remove logs older than 15 days.
0 2 * * * find /var/log/oracle -name '*.log' -mtime +15 -exec rm -f {} \;
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSENAME LIKE %Math%;
SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSENAME LIKE '%Math%';
Write a SQL query to find professors who don't teach any courses.
SELECT PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE PROFID NOT IN (SELECT PROFID FROM A_COURSES);
Create a PL/SQL trigger to automatically assign current date to ENROLLDATE when a new enrollment is inserted.
CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_auto_enrolldate BEFORE INSERT ON A_ENROLLMENTS FOR EACH ROW BEGIN :NEW.ENROLLDATE := SYSDATE; END;
Add a new column IS_ACTIVE to A_PROFESSORS with default value 'Y'.
ALTER TABLE A_PROFESSORS ADD (IS_ACTIVE CHAR(1) DEFAULT 'Y');
Schedule a DBMS_SCHEDULER job that runs a health check every hour.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'hourly_health_check', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN perform_health_check(); END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=HOURLY;', enabled => TRUE); END;
Fix the SQL: SELECT DEPTNAME, COUNT(*) FROM A_PROFESSORS GROUPBY DEPTNAME;
SELECT DEPTNAME, COUNT(*) FROM A_PROFESSORS GROUP BY DEPTNAME;
Write a SQL query to find students who are not enrolled in any course.
SELECT STUDENTID, FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID NOT IN (SELECT STUDENTID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS);
Create a PL/SQL procedure to delete all enrollments for a given course.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE delete_course_enrollments(p_courseid NUMBER) IS BEGIN DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE COURSEID = p_courseid; COMMIT; END;
Drop the constraint profname_not_null from A_PROFESSORS table.
ALTER TABLE A_PROFESSORS DROP CONSTRAINT profname_not_null;
Fix the SQL: SELECT COUNT STUDENTID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS;
SELECT COUNT(STUDENTID) FROM A_ENROLLMENTS;
Write a SQL query to find the number of students enrolled in each course.
SELECT C.COURSENAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS NUM_STUDENTS FROM A_COURSES C LEFT JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME;
Create a PL/SQL package to manage professor assignments.

CREATE OR REPLACE PACKAGE prof_mgmt AS PROCEDURE assign_prof(p_courseid NUMBER, p_profid NUMBER); END prof_mgmt; /
CREATE OR REPLACE PACKAGE BODY prof_mgmt AS PROCEDURE assign_prof(p_courseid NUMBER, p_profid NUMBER) IS BEGIN UPDATE A_COURSES SET PROFID = p_profid WHERE COURSEID = p_courseid; COMMIT; END assign_prof; END prof_mgmt;
Grant SELECT and INSERT privileges on A_ENROLLMENTS to user 'REPORT_USER'.
GRANT SELECT, INSERT ON A_ENROLLMENTS TO REPORT_USER;
Schedule a job using DBMS_SCHEDULER to back up the A_STUDENTS table every Friday night at 11 PM.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'backup_students_weekly', job_type => 'EXECUTABLE', job_action => '/home/oracle/scripts/backup_students.sh', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=FRI;BYHOUR=23;BYMINUTE=0', enabled => TRUE); END;
Alter A_ENROLLMENTS table to add a STATUS column with default value 'ACTIVE'.
ALTER TABLE A_ENROLLMENTS ADD (STATUS VARCHAR2(20) DEFAULT 'ACTIVE');
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE BETWEEN 01/01/2023 AND 12/31/2023;
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE BETWEEN TO_DATE('2023-01-01','YYYY-MM-DD') AND TO_DATE('2023-12-31','YYYY-MM-DD');
Write a SQL query to find departments with no courses assigned.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D WHERE D.DEPTID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT DEPTID FROM A_COURSES);
Create a PL/SQL trigger to prevent deleting a professor if they are assigned to a course.

CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_prevent_prof_delete BEFORE DELETE ON A_PROFESSORS FOR EACH ROW DECLARE v_count NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_count FROM A_COURSES WHERE PROFID = :OLD.PROFID; IF v_count > 0 THEN RAISE_APPLICATION_ERROR(-20001, 'Cannot delete professor assigned to a course.'); END IF; END;
Create a new tablespace for department-related tables.
CREATE TABLESPACE dept_data DATAFILE 'dept_data01.dbf' SIZE 200M AUTOEXTEND ON NEXT 50M MAXSIZE 2G;
Create a CRON job to clean up temporary files in /tmp every day at midnight.
0 0 * * * find /tmp -type f -name '*.tmp' -mtime +1 -exec rm {} \;
Fix the SQL: SELECT STUDENTID, ENROLLDATE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE > '2022-01-01';
SELECT STUDENTID, ENROLLDATE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE > TO_DATE('2022-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Write a SQL query to get professors and the number of courses they are teaching.
SELECT P.PROFNAME, COUNT(C.COURSEID) AS COURSE_COUNT FROM A_PROFESSORS P LEFT JOIN A_COURSES C ON P.PROFID = C.PROFID GROUP BY P.PROFNAME;
Create a PL/SQL block to transfer a course to another department.
DECLARE v_courseid NUMBER := 101; v_new_deptid NUMBER := 3; BEGIN UPDATE A_COURSES SET DEPTID = v_new_deptid WHERE COURSEID = v_courseid; COMMIT; END;
Add a NOT NULL constraint on COURSENAME in A_COURSES.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES MODIFY (COURSENAME VARCHAR2(100) NOT NULL);
Schedule a job that runs every 5 minutes to check recent enrollments.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'check_recent_enrollments', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN check_recent_enrollments_proc(); END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=MINUTELY;INTERVAL=5', enabled => TRUE); END;
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTID = '10';
SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE DEPTID = 10; -- DEPTID is NUMBER, not string
Write a SQL query to list the names of students and their professors.

SELECT S.FIRSTNAME || ' ' || S.LASTNAME AS STUDENT_NAME, P.PROFNAME FROM A_ENROLLMENTS E JOIN A_STUDENTS S ON E.STUDENTID = S.STUDENTID JOIN A_COURSES C ON E.COURSEID = C.COURSEID JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON C.PROFID = P.PROFID;
Create a PL/SQL block to bulk delete students with no enrollments.
BEGIN DELETE FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT STUDENTID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS); COMMIT; END;
Drop and recreate the primary key on A_DEPARTMENTS.DEPTID.
ALTER TABLE A_DEPARTMENTS DROP PRIMARY KEY; ALTER TABLE A_DEPARTMENTS ADD CONSTRAINT pk_dept PRIMARY KEY (DEPTID);
Fix the SQL: SELECT * A_COURSES WHERE DEPTID IN (SELECT DEPTID FROM A_DEPARTMENTS WHERE DEPTNAME = 'Math');
SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE DEPTID IN (SELECT DEPTID FROM A_DEPARTMENTS WHERE DEPTNAME = 'Math');
Write a SQL query to find the names of all professors in the 'Computer Science' department.
SELECT P.PROFNAME FROM A_PROFESSORS P JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID WHERE D.DEPTNAME = 'Computer Science';
Create a PL/SQL procedure to update a student's last name by student ID.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE update_lastname(p_studentid NUMBER, p_lastname VARCHAR2) IS BEGIN UPDATE A_STUDENTS SET LASTNAME = p_lastname WHERE STUDENTID = p_studentid; COMMIT; END;
Create an index on COURSENAME in the A_COURSES table.
CREATE INDEX idx_course_name ON A_COURSES(COURSENAME);
Schedule a DBMS_SCHEDULER job that runs every 10 minutes to archive logs.

Alter the A_STUDENTS table to modify LASTNAME to VARCHAR2(100).
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS MODIFY (LASTNAME VARCHAR2(100));
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE = '15-MAR-2024';
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE = TO_DATE('15-MAR-2024','DD-MON-YYYY');

SELECT D.DEPTNAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS TOTAL_ENROLLED FROM A_ENROLLMENTS E JOIN A_COURSES C ON E.COURSEID = C.COURSEID JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON C.DEPTID = D.DEPTID GROUP BY D.DEPTNAME;

Export the A_PROFESSORS table using Data Pump.
expdp user/password DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR DUMPFILE=professors.dmp LOGFILE=professors.log TABLES=A_PROFESSORS
Create a CRON job to run a PL/SQL script every Monday at 6 AM.
0 6 * * MON /u01/app/oracle/scripts/run_weekly_script.sh
Fix the SQL: SELECT STUDENTID, ENROLLDATE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE >= 2023-01-01;
SELECT STUDENTID, ENROLLDATE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE >= TO_DATE('2023-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Write a SQL query to list students along with their enrolled course names and professor names.

Create a PL/SQL trigger that logs inserts into A_COURSES table.
CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_log_course_insert AFTER INSERT ON A_COURSES FOR EACH ROW BEGIN INSERT INTO course_log (COURSEID, ACTION_DATE) VALUES (:NEW.COURSEID, SYSDATE); END;
Drop the STATUS column from A_ENROLLMENTS.
ALTER TABLE A_ENROLLMENTS DROP COLUMN STATUS;
Schedule a DBMS_SCHEDULER job to update statistics daily at 3 AM.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'daily_stats_update', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN DBMS_STATS.gather_schema_stats(ownname => ''MY_SCHEMA''); END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=DAILY;BYHOUR=3', enabled => TRUE); END;
Fix the SQL: SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE DEPTID = NULL;
SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE DEPTID IS NULL;
Write a SQL query to list courses with no enrolled students.
SELECT C.COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES C WHERE C.COURSEID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT COURSEID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS);
Create a PL/SQL procedure to transfer a professor from one department to another.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE transfer_professor(p_profid NUMBER, p_new_deptid NUMBER) IS BEGIN UPDATE A_PROFESSORS SET DEPTID = p_new_deptid WHERE PROFID = p_profid; COMMIT; END;
Rename the column COURSENAME in A_COURSES to TITLE.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES RENAME COLUMN COURSENAME TO TITLE;
Fix the SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM A_ENROLLMENTS GROUPED BY COURSEID;
SELECT COURSEID, COUNT(*) FROM A_ENROLLMENTS GROUP BY COURSEID;
Write a SQL query to list the number of courses offered by each department.
SELECT D.DEPTNAME, COUNT(C.COURSEID) AS COURSE_COUNT FROM A_DEPARTMENTS D LEFT JOIN A_COURSES C ON D.DEPTID = C.DEPTID GROUP BY D.DEPTNAME;
Create a PL/SQL function that returns the full name of a student given their student ID.

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION get_student_fullname(p_studentid NUMBER) RETURN VARCHAR2 IS v_fullname VARCHAR2(200); BEGIN SELECT FIRSTNAME || ' ' || LASTNAME INTO v_fullname FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID = p_studentid; RETURN v_fullname; END;
Rebuild all indexes in the A_COURSES table.
ALTER INDEX ALL ON A_COURSES REBUILD;
Schedule a job to purge old enrollments older than 5 years, every Sunday at midnight.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'purge_old_enrollments', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE < ADD_MONTHS(SYSDATE, -60); COMMIT; END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=SUN;BYHOUR=0;BYMINUTE=0', enabled => TRUE); END;
Add a unique constraint on COURSENAME in A_COURSES.
ALTER TABLE A_COURSES ADD CONSTRAINT uq_course_name UNIQUE (COURSENAME);
Fix this SQL: SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE = '1995-07-21';
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE = TO_DATE('1995-07-21', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Write a SQL query to get the names of students who have not enrolled in any course.
SELECT FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID NOT IN (SELECT DISTINCT STUDENTID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS);
Create a PL/SQL trigger to prevent enrolling a student in the same course twice.

CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_prevent_duplicate_enroll BEFORE INSERT ON A_ENROLLMENTS FOR EACH ROW DECLARE v_count NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_count FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE STUDENTID = :NEW.STUDENTID AND COURSEID = :NEW.COURSEID; IF v_count > 0 THEN RAISE_APPLICATION_ERROR(-20002, 'Duplicate enrollment not allowed.'); END IF; END;
Create a new partition for the A_ENROLLMENTS table based on ENROLLDATE.

ALTER TABLE A_ENROLLMENTS MODIFY PARTITION BY RANGE (ENROLLDATE) ( PARTITION enroll_2023 VALUES LESS THAN (TO_DATE('2024-01-01','YYYY-MM-DD')), PARTITION enroll_2024 VALUES LESS THAN (TO_DATE('2025-01-01','YYYY-MM-DD')) );
Create a CRON job that checks disk space every hour.
0 * * * * df -h > /var/log/disk_usage.log
Fix the SQL: SELECT FIRSTNAME + LASTNAME AS NAME FROM A_STUDENTS;
SELECT FIRSTNAME || ' ' || LASTNAME AS NAME FROM A_STUDENTS;
Write a SQL query to show each course along with the number of enrolled students and the professor's name.

SELECT C.COURSENAME, COUNT(E.STUDENTID) AS NUM_ENROLLED, P.PROFNAME FROM A_COURSES C LEFT JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON C.COURSEID = E.COURSEID LEFT JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON C.PROFID = P.PROFID GROUP BY C.COURSENAME, P.PROFNAME;
Create a PL/SQL procedure to delete all enrollments of a student.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE delete_student_enrollments(p_studentid NUMBER) IS BEGIN DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE STUDENTID = p_studentid; COMMIT; END;
Drop the index idx_course_name from A_COURSES.
DROP INDEX idx_course_name;
Schedule a job to refresh materialized views every day at 2 AM.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'refresh_mv_job', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN DBMS_MVIEW.REFRESH(''mv_example''); END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=DAILY;BYHOUR=2', enabled => TRUE); END;
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE PROFID = NULL;
SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE PROFID IS NULL;
Write a SQL query to find courses taught by professors from the 'Mathematics' department.
SELECT C.COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES C JOIN A_PROFESSORS P ON C.PROFID = P.PROFID JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON P.DEPTID = D.DEPTID WHERE D.DEPTNAME = 'Mathematics';
Create a PL/SQL block that prints the total number of courses in the system.
DECLARE v_total NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_total FROM A_COURSES; DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Total courses: ' || v_total); END;
Export all student data using Data Pump to a custom directory.
expdp user/password DIRECTORY=STUDENT_EXPORT_DIR DUMPFILE=students.dmp LOGFILE=students_export.log TABLES=A_STUDENTS
Fix the SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) AS TOTAL FROM A_PROFESSORS GROUPED BY DEPTID;
SELECT DEPTID, COUNT(*) AS TOTAL FROM A_PROFESSORS GROUP BY DEPTID;
Write a SQL query to list all students born after January 1, 2000.
SELECT * FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE BIRTHDATE > TO_DATE('2000-01-01', 'YYYY-MM-DD');
Create a PL/SQL procedure to insert a new course.

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE add_course(p_courseid NUMBER, p_coursename VARCHAR2, p_deptid NUMBER, p_profid NUMBER) IS BEGIN INSERT INTO A_COURSES (COURSEID, COURSENAME, DEPTID, PROFID) VALUES (p_courseid, p_coursename, p_deptid, p_profid); COMMIT; END;
Create a tablespace named 'USERS_DATA' with 100MB size.
CREATE TABLESPACE USERS_DATA DATAFILE '/u01/app/oracle/oradata/users_data01.dbf' SIZE 100M AUTOEXTEND ON NEXT 10M;
Schedule a job using DBMS_SCHEDULER to delete enrollments older than 10 years weekly.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'delete_old_enrollments', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE < ADD_MONTHS(SYSDATE, -120); COMMIT; END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=SUN', enabled => TRUE); END;
Alter A_STUDENTS to add a column 'EMAIL' with VARCHAR2(255).
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS ADD (EMAIL VARCHAR2(255));
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE STUDENTID = '123';
SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE STUDENTID = 123;
Write a query to list professors with the number of courses they teach.
SELECT P.PROFNAME, COUNT(C.COURSEID) AS COURSE_COUNT FROM A_PROFESSORS P LEFT JOIN A_COURSES C ON P.PROFID = C.PROFID GROUP BY P.PROFNAME;
Create a trigger that updates a 'last_modified' column in A_COURSES on UPDATE.
CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_update_last_modified BEFORE UPDATE ON A_COURSES FOR EACH ROW BEGIN :NEW.last_modified := SYSDATE; END;
Create a partition on A_ENROLLMENTS by year of ENROLLDATE.
ALTER TABLE A_ENROLLMENTS PARTITION BY RANGE (EXTRACT(YEAR FROM ENROLLDATE)) (PARTITION p_2022 VALUES LESS THAN (2023), PARTITION p_2023 VALUES LESS THAN (2024));
Schedule a CRON job to run an export every day at 1 AM.
0 1 * * * /u01/app/oracle/scripts/export_data.sh
Fix the SQL: SELECT FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID LIKE 101;
SELECT FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS WHERE STUDENTID = 101;
Write a query to list students along with their department names via their courses.
SELECT S.FIRSTNAME, S.LASTNAME, D.DEPTNAME FROM A_STUDENTS S JOIN A_ENROLLMENTS E ON S.STUDENTID = E.STUDENTID JOIN A_COURSES C ON E.COURSEID = C.COURSEID JOIN A_DEPARTMENTS D ON C.DEPTID = D.DEPTID;
Create a procedure to assign a professor to a course.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE assign_professor(p_courseid NUMBER, p_profid NUMBER) IS BEGIN UPDATE A_COURSES SET PROFID = p_profid WHERE COURSEID = p_courseid; COMMIT; END;
Drop the tablespace USERS_DATA.
DROP TABLESPACE USERS_DATA INCLUDING CONTENTS AND DATAFILES;
Schedule a job to refresh stats every Sunday at 11 PM.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'weekly_stats_refresh', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN DBMS_STATS.gather_schema_stats(''MY_SCHEMA''); END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=SUN;BYHOUR=23', enabled => TRUE); END;
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE PROFNAME == 'Smith';
SELECT * FROM A_PROFESSORS WHERE PROFNAME = 'Smith';
Write a query to find courses without any assigned professor.
SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE PROFID IS NULL;
Create a PL/SQL block to count total students and print result.
DECLARE v_count NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_count FROM A_STUDENTS; DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Total students: ' || v_count); END;
Export A_COURSES table data to dump file courses.dmp.
expdp user/password DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR DUMPFILE=courses.dmp LOGFILE=courses_export.log TABLES=A_COURSES
Fix the SQL: SELECT DEPTID, COUNT(*) AS NUM FROM A_PROFESSORS GROUPED BY DEPTID;
SELECT DEPTID, COUNT(*) AS NUM FROM A_PROFESSORS GROUP BY DEPTID;
Write a SQL query to find the total number of students enrolled in each course.
SELECT COURSEID, COUNT(STUDENTID) AS TOTAL_ENROLLED FROM A_ENROLLMENTS GROUP BY COURSEID;
Create a PL/SQL procedure to update a professor's department.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE update_prof_department(p_profid NUMBER, p_deptid NUMBER) IS BEGIN UPDATE A_PROFESSORS SET DEPTID = p_deptid WHERE PROFID = p_profid; COMMIT; END;
Create an index on the COURSENAME column in A_COURSES.
CREATE INDEX idx_coursename ON A_COURSES(COURSENAME);
Schedule a DBMS_SCHEDULER job to archive enrollments older than 3 years monthly.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'archive_old_enrollments', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN INSERT INTO enrollments_archive SELECT * FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE < ADD_MONTHS(SYSDATE, -36); DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE ENROLLDATE < ADD_MONTHS(SYSDATE, -36); COMMIT; END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=MONTHLY;BYMONTHDAY=1', enabled => TRUE); END;
Alter A_STUDENTS table to increase FIRSTNAME length to 100.
ALTER TABLE A_STUDENTS MODIFY (FIRSTNAME VARCHAR2(100));
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_DEPARTMENTS WHERE DEPTNAME = "Science";
SELECT * FROM A_DEPARTMENTS WHERE DEPTNAME = 'Science';
Write a SQL query to find professors who teach more than 2 courses.
SELECT PROFID, COUNT(*) AS COURSE_COUNT FROM A_COURSES GROUP BY PROFID HAVING COUNT(*) > 2;
Create a trigger to log changes in the A_PROFESSORS table to a separate audit table.

CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER trg_professor_audit AFTER UPDATE ON A_PROFESSORS FOR EACH ROW BEGIN INSERT INTO A_PROFESSORS_AUDIT (PROFID, OLD_DEPTID, NEW_DEPTID, CHANGE_DATE) VALUES (:OLD.PROFID, :OLD.DEPTID, :NEW.DEPTID, SYSDATE); END;
Create partitions on A_ENROLLMENTS by year for 2020 and 2021.
ALTER TABLE A_ENROLLMENTS PARTITION BY RANGE (EXTRACT(YEAR FROM ENROLLDATE)) (PARTITION p_2020 VALUES LESS THAN (2021), PARTITION p_2021 VALUES LESS THAN (2022));
Set up a cron job to backup the Oracle database at 3 AM daily.
0 3 * * * /u01/app/oracle/backup_scripts/backup.sh
Fix the SQL: SELECT FIRSTNAME || LASTNAME AS FULLNAME FROM A_STUDENTS;
SELECT FIRSTNAME || ' ' || LASTNAME AS FULLNAME FROM A_STUDENTS;
Write a query to find all courses that have no students enrolled.
SELECT COURSENAME FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSEID NOT IN (SELECT COURSEID FROM A_ENROLLMENTS);
Create a PL/SQL procedure to delete enrollments by course ID.
CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE delete_enrollments_by_course(p_courseid NUMBER) IS BEGIN DELETE FROM A_ENROLLMENTS WHERE COURSEID = p_courseid; COMMIT; END;
Drop index idx_coursename on A_COURSES.
DROP INDEX idx_coursename;
Schedule a job to gather stats every Saturday at 1 AM.

BEGIN DBMS_SCHEDULER.create_job( job_name => 'weekly_stats_gather', job_type => 'PLSQL_BLOCK', job_action => 'BEGIN DBMS_STATS.gather_schema_stats(''MY_SCHEMA''); END;', repeat_interval => 'FREQ=WEEKLY;BYDAY=SAT;BYHOUR=1', enabled => TRUE); END;
Fix the SQL: SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSENAME LIKE '%Maths';
SELECT * FROM A_COURSES WHERE COURSENAME LIKE '%Maths%';
Find departments with no courses offered.
SELECT DEPTNAME FROM A_DEPARTMENTS WHERE DEPTID NOT IN (SELECT DEPTID FROM A_COURSES);
Write a PL/SQL block to print the total number of professors.
DECLARE v_count NUMBER; BEGIN SELECT COUNT(*) INTO v_count FROM A_PROFESSORS; DBMS_OUTPUT.PUT_LINE('Total professors: ' || v_count); END;

expdp user/password DIRECTORY=DATA_PUMP_DIR DUMPFILE=enrollments.dmp LOGFILE=enrollments_export.log TABLES=A_ENROLLMENTS

SELECT STUDENTID, COUNT(*) FROM A_ENROLLMENTS GROUP BY STUDENTID;
